instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no back light
threads.message:
This was pure water damaged around video connector and some other place too. After ultrasonic turn on but no backlight.
Backlight out was 8.5 v so
Changed bklight driver and got the back light back but after few minutes again bklighet gone. changed bklight driver again

now bklight out is 20.9v. Bkl-EN=2.8v, bkl-pwm=1.46!!!!

but no backlight. I did all reset and this is good know screen. what next, any help please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no back light
threads.message:
I recommend to reflow <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>; bad solders I think.
Be sure to have good continuity from A5 ball to <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>.

You can also make a "force" test.
Remove <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> and bring <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> to <CAPACITOR>C7704</CAPACITOR>.
If you get max backlight, then turn off and do PRAM reset.
Next, restore the board components and check if it works...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no back light
threads.message: 20 volts should be backlight. Replace driver again MAKE SURE it’s soldered well

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no back light
threads.message: 20V is insuficient; can only get very dim backlight, almost nothing...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no back light
threads.message: Replaced again bklight driver and fix the path A5. Thanks a lot, you guys awesome.
